intro: Phrygilanthus novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea phrygilanthus, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
